author: Lynn Jeffrey
comment: The Guardian is the best, most informative and reliable source of news and events. I particularly enjoy the thoughtful opinion pieces. The readers' comments range from insightful and thought provoking to the myopic and poorly written. I enjoy the ability to add my voice to the cacophony. Reading the Guardian is  pleasure, though what I read often makes me sad or angry. For the times we live, the voice of the Guardian is a beacon of freedom. It must never be allowed to be extinguished.

author: Saeta Negra
comment: There's probably not a better free app out there ... and not many paid ones either. There's an opportunity to contribute financially - and you should if you can. In a sensible world it would be seen as middle-of-the-road. I find it relevant and quick off the mark

author: Maria Cindea
comment: Too bad the comment streams "jump" many times during normal use, to the point where following a discussion or participating is unworkable. User's own comments stream also randomly "forget" some comments, even though they exist on the web.

author: David Cormack
comment: Visually appealing, no ad distraction, seems to be as much content as the paid version. Would much prefer to pay and support  as free is unsustainable. Still pay for the now unsupported subs version. Shame Guardian forced down this loss making route but without journalistic compromise. How long will it last.

author: Matt Jeffries
comment: I previously had the shambolic BBC news app. So what a ray of sunshine this app is. Allows you to edit what news stories you wish to have on your homepage, so everything is just a swipe away. 5 stars.

author: Dan Hooton
comment: The articles are great as usual, but unfortunately the crosswords are no longer playable. With the latest update, when I click on a particular clue, it just turns into a solid black bar, therefore unreadable. As they are one of the main reasons I subscribe, I will be cancelling until an update has been issued to fix this problem.

author: Mohammad Omar
comment: This app isnt working any more. Plus all its news is just your average propaganda bull.s.

author: Lamone Jones
comment: I can't login to my account. After an update, uninstalling and reinstalling the application, I still can't sign-in. The login page is broken. Hey application developers fix the login issues already! I loved the application beforehand. Now due to the fact I can't sign-in, this application is worthless.

author: Grant Chisholm
comment: The recent redesign and app update is absolutely awful.  My widget won't update news and keeps giving me news which is now a week old. Found previous layout much better.

author: Bob O'Mahoney
comment: Love this paper BUT PLEASE fix the crossword! As soon as I select a clue it disappears under a black box. PLEASE....... Crossword now fixed.Thank you. 21 Feb 2018

author: Mike Lee
comment: I paid for a subscription mainly so I could have access to the crosswords. Since the recent update, the "selected" crossword clue has black text on a black background, which is beyond useless.

author: Mark Tulley
comment: Quick and easy to use. The adverts are small but still a bit annoying. I donated £25 but still the adverts come, beware!

author: Ann Smith
comment: My first read each morning. The Guardian says it like it is, is right up to date and keeps me in touch with news and opionion. A good variety of columnists ensures there is something for everyone. Really enjoy the comments, biased and unbiased!!

OMG, what am I going to do during my 30 minute lunch break? Please fix the crossword. Happy to support the paper, but having access to crosswords and no ads is a great tradeoff.. although without my access to puzzles it ain't quid pro quo.  21/2/18: Thanks for fixing the crossword!

What a bad decision to suddenly stop supporting Android version of the Guardian Daily edition. I will now cancel my subscription and demand a refund. Maybe you should have rebranded as "iGuardian" to be in line with your new paymasters. Shame on you for not giving us longer notice of this denial of service.

author: Astrid Muller
comment: You took a Premium Tier subscription payment 2.49 two days ago but now I have to re-subscribe at 4.99. What a swizz. Zero information about this price rise.

author: Peter Brownlow
comment: Especially during breaking national & international news events. However, I'm still struggling to find a balance between alerts being too spammy & not spammy enough.

author: SUSHANT KHANNA
comment: The Feature of Reading the articles Free of cost Makes You feel Very Special as because Getting premium quality of news Without Paying Anything is very rare As Being one of The World's leading News Provider Guardian Is doing It's Job Whole Heartedly And I am Privelege To become a Subscriber Of Guardian. The Whole Hard work Is Delivering the Fruit Which it should

author: casey jones
comment: I would be lost without it. Thanks Guardian for keeping me abreast of news plus the quick crossword helps me pretend I'm doing something to fight against early onset dementia. I am one of the lefty metropolitan elite but luckily the Archers keeps me in touch with the rest of the country so I feel I'm getting a balance.
Have not been using app long but so far it is great. And, good journalists too. Thank you

author: Mark Norman
comment: I don't always agree with the editorial content but the app works really well. If you can afford it please contribute. Quality news doesn't come cheap.

author: Jamie Birley
comment: They can't spell but I love them anyway.  ♥️

author: Robert Le Mur
comment: New theme is ugly and I wish I knew what the loudspeaker icon that appears in the bottom right hand corner of the screen does.

author: Matthew Gowaseb
comment: The new layout sucks. Very heavy fonts. Who came up with the new black and white masthead/logo.

author: Hal Jordan
comment: Great app just had to adjust phone settings to stop it going off all hours.  Update: most used news app. Love it. Preferred the old layout though. Felt warmer.

author: Bob Smith
comment: The white look is really hard on the eyes, what was wrong about the blue look. May cancel my subscription, don't like it at all. Zero Stars! Update 24/2/18 In protest against the new look, I have as promised cancelled my subscription.

author: Rhoda Neville
comment: The only thing missing since the latest update is the daily briefings. What has happened to them? I've signed up for the email notifications and received nary a one.
Still getting used to the new design but overall love the app. Great for looking at news even when you're not connected to the net

author: Jim Hunter
comment: Excellent newsflash notifications. First for breaking news.

author: Dominic Pulsford
comment: It's the only way to wake up.  If I had a dog it would miss bringing me the paper in the morning. Saves on dog food too.

author: Alex Goetze
comment: Love the app. Best newspaper in UK. Just one thing I don't like,  why are your articles so long? I find it sometimes very hard to concentrate till the end. You can deliver good news with less text.

author: Michael Sharman
comment: Quality fair minded journalism that represents the UK and the world at its best, in the face of right wing bias and fake news.

author: Alireza Salehnia
comment: Guardian journalism is certainly among the best, alongside those like NYT, LAT, and WSJ but the thing about guardian is that its free to read, and this app provides the best features for you to enjoy your free reading...

author: Chris Dack
comment: Hi. Why am I unable to zoom as many pictures as I used to.  Clicking on most pictures doesn't open in full screen

reply.author: Guardian News & Media Ltd
reply.content: Hi Chris, I think we should have the same number of pictures on the front page as before, perhaps you were using the "condensed layout" (available in the settings) before the update? I will investigate the crashing you mention, thank you.

comment: The Guardian needs to reconsider what breaking news is. The Oscar results are not important enough to send multiple push notifications about.

author: Geoff Skinner
comment: Reading the Guardian app won't always make you happier, but you will understand the world better and have access to one of the best sources of "true news" available.

author: Evie Michael
comment: Since the last update, ads have been appearing across my screen and covering content. As I move the page, the ad seems to follow. Even when i ask for the ad to be removed, the space where the ad was is still obstructing the article making it unreadable. I don't mind ads that are in-line with your article, but when it covers the article and impedes reading it does not make me want to use your app- let alone continue making contributions. Please fix and I'll increase the star rating and continue making contributions.

author: Malcolm Barron
comment: I enjoy reading the articles which are well written and thoughtful, not sensationalist like many of the tabloid papers. Unfortunately the crosswords are not working, all I see is a grey screen.

author: David Wilson
comment: Love this app.  But the widget seems to have stopped working on my Nexus 6p

author: Ros Patching
comment: My main news and article-reading app. Can't praise too highly.
